title: Sentence
description: Term of imprisonment or probation, or amount of fines, imposed on a convicted defendant for criminal wrongdoing, or the amount of damages imposed for civil cases. Generally, the amount of punishment for an offense. A sentence must be connected to only one court case. A court case may have one or more sentences.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "sentence--" and is appended with a UUIDv4.

sentence_type.description: The type of sentence that was ordered.

quantity.description: The quantity of the sentence type imposed. MUST be used with the `metric` property if used.

metric.description: The measurement type of the sentence imposed. MUST be used with the `quantity` property if used.

concurrency.description: Whether the sentence is to run concurrently (at the same time as) other sentences within the same case.

oneOf.title: Assessment/Special Assessment
oneOf.description: A type of fine that always applies to each count of a convicted crime.

oneOf.title: Community Service
oneOf.description: Unpaid work that benefits the community.

oneOf.title: Damages
oneOf.description: An attempt to measure in financial terms the extent of harm a plaintiff has suffered because of the defendant's actions. Damges can be compensatory, punative, or statutory, and are usually attached to civil cases.

oneOf.title: Deportation
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to leave the country where the case is being tried.

oneOf.title: Drug Testing
oneOf.description: Regular screening ordered to test for drugs.

oneOf.title: Fine
oneOf.description: A financial punishment for violating a criminal law. Usually attached to criminal cases rather than civil.

oneOf.title: Forfeiture
oneOf.description: Loss of property, right, or privilege without compensation.

oneOf.title: House Arrest
oneOf.description: Confinement to a particular location for the duration of the sentence.

oneOf.title: Incarceration
oneOf.description: Imprisonment.

oneOf.title: Injunction/Restraining Order
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to cease doing a particular action. E.g., using stolen IP in their business.

oneOf.title: Mental Health Treatment
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to an inpatient or outpatient mental health facility, or is ordered to attend therapy for mental health issues.

oneOf.title: No Internet Access
oneOf.description: Defendant is not allowed to access the Internet via any type of device.

oneOf.title: Probation
oneOf.description: Defendant is released into the community in lieu of a prison sentence, but is subject to sepcial conditions and restrictions such as other types of sentences in this vocabulary.

oneOf.title: Restitution
oneOf.description: An attempt to measure in financial terms the extent of the gains or profits the defendant obtained through harming the victim.

oneOf.title: Substance Abuse Treatment
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to attend inpatient or outpatient treatment for substance abuse issues.

oneOf.title: Supervised Release
oneOf.description: Defendant is released into the community, subject to special conditions and restrictions, after the completion of a prison sentence.

oneOf.title: Hour(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of hours. E.g. 20 hours community service.

oneOf.title: Day(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of days. E.g. 30 days in a substance abuse treatment facility.

oneOf.title: Month(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of months. E.g. 18 months imprisonment.

oneOf.title: Year(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of years. E.g. 5 years no Internet access.

oneOf.title: Dollar(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of dollars. E.g. $10,000 in damages.
